snippet: Three years after financial reform was passed, President Obama wants regulators to act quickly. But does he want them to act forcefully?
abstract: Editorial asserts that Pres Obama should use his bully pulpit to not only speed up regulators' implementation of Dodd-Frank financial reform law, but also to make sure that regulations are not watered down.
lead_paragraph: Three years after financial reform was passed, President Obama wants regulators to act quickly. But does he want them to act forcefully?

headline.main: Rules for Wall Street to Live By
headline.print_headline: Rules for Wall Street to Live By

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
